method.text: Whisk together the egg yolks and sugar until thick, pale and creamy. Heat the single cream in a pan until almost boiling. Slowly pour onto the egg mixture, stirring constantly.

Strain the custard through a sieve back into the pan. Cook over a gentle heat stirring constantly for 5-8 min or until slightly thickened. Whilst heating the custard add the coffee essence and vanilla fudge, stirring constantly until dissolved. DO NOT BOIL OR IT WILL CURDLE. Pour the custard into a clean bowl and leave to cool.
Lightly whip the double cream and fold into the custard. Pour into a shallow freezer-proof container. Cover and freeze until mushy. This will take approximately 1 days.
Turn the ice cream into a chilled bowl and mash with a fork to break up any ice crystals. Re-freeze until frozen solid.
Allow the ice cream to soften slightly at room temperature before serving.
